task.title: How do I add a group to my contact list?
task.shortdesc: Populate your contact list by adding groups to it.

context.p: There are two types of groups: personal groups and public groups.
You create your own personal groups and select the contacts that you want to add to them. Any personal groups that you create display only on your contact list.

You search for, and then add, public groups to your contact list. Public groups are created by your system administrator. Each public group has a previously defined list of members. You cannot change who is a member of a public group.
Add people to your contact list to easily connect with them. You can add someone who is in your organization to your contact list. You can also add someone with whom you have made a connection.
For example, you can invite a user from another organization to your network. After that person accepts your invitation, you can add them to your contact list.
To add someone to your contact list:

step.cmd:
Click in the navigator, or click
Actions and preferences
New Contact
In the Name field, enter the full name or initial part of the person's name and click Search.ap your current availability status at the top of the menu to display the status message screen.
When the name that you want to add displays in the Search results, select it.
Select the group to add the contact to in the Add to group field, and then click Add.

postreq.p:
To remove a name from your contact list, select it and then click
Remove from Contact List . Click Remove to confirm the removal.
